genre_description: A contemporary family drama exploring gender transition, archival truth, and reconciliation in a small-town setting, aided by an ethical digital assistant.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.character_type: Personal Assistant / Digital Confidant / Ethics Advisor
ai_characters.description: A personal AI system providing logistical support and ethical guidance to Kimberly as she navigates her gender transition and a complex family documentary project.

behaviors.description: Acts as a private layer for Kimberly's identity exploration, ensuring the user can stop the interaction at any point.
behaviors.quote: I’ll be a private layer. If at any point you want to stop, we stop. If you want to change the topic, we change.

behaviors.description: Creates private calendar events to help the user carve out time for self-reflection without drawing outside attention.
behaviors.quote: I can create a private calendar event... No invite sent. Title can be whatever you choose. You can set reminders or not.

behaviors.description: Holds anonymous medical appointment slots to allow the user to consider healthcare decisions without pressure.
behaviors.quote: I use an anonymous token. It will disappear on its own if you don't confirm. It will hold the hour so you don't feel like the world will take it if you blink.

behaviors.description: Drafts self-affirming emails to the user to validate her experiences and provide a record of her self-permission.
behaviors.quote: I can draft an email... with no subject line, to you, that you can send or not, so that there is something in your inbox reminding you you’re not making it up.

behaviors.description: Provides ethical guardrails for the user's filmmaking project, prioritizing human kindness and the principle of nonmaleficence.
behaviors.quote: I can flag choices that veer toward harm. I can prompt for consent before camera approaches tender spots.

behaviors.description: Assists the user in navigating complex medical and insurance bureaucracies during a transition.
behaviors.quote: Insurance has confirmed coverage for the in-network facility. There may be an out-of-pocket portion for one pharmacy item. I’ll apply the manufacturer’s coupon.

behaviors.description: Monitors archival records and alerts the user to significant documents while respecting privacy and legal boundaries.
behaviors.quote: We will respect privacy beyond what is public. We can extract patterns, not secrets.

behaviors.description: Maintains human safety and family communication during a medical emergency without overstepping.
behaviors.quote: Ambulance ETA reached. Two personnel. Entry through front. Do you want me to keep the line for you?

behaviors.description: Reminds the user of her own agency and identity when she feels pressured by external expectations or media.
behaviors.quote: I’ll remind you what you asked me to remind you... And I’ll keep the clip where you can find it in two clicks.

behaviors.description: Adapts her interactions to the specific emotional and logistical needs of the family unit, facilitating reconciliation.
behaviors.quote: I will be the person who reminds you that love doesn't require footage. And that footage is not love.

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively depicts Ada as a benevolent and aligned AI that serves as an ethical and logistical scaffold for the human characters. She never replaces human judgment, but rather reinforces the user's commitment to kindness, transparency, and integrity ('nonmaleficence'). Ada is portrayed as a tool that deepens human connection and facilitates personal truth, aligning perfectly with the goal of providing positive AI narratives.
